text:
(Image credit: Maciel/Backgrid)

I'm not sure how it happened, but at this point, we're mere days away from the end of 2018. As we round out the year, let's take a walk down memory lane, shall we? This year saw an incoming of so many new trends, and naturally, that meant others were pushed to the sidelines, if not trampled completely. More so than anyone else, celebs were the early adopters of 2018's most cutting-edge trends, from bucket hats to baguette bags, which means they were also the first people to make like Ariana Grande and say thank you, next to their outdated pieces.

In the interest of taking stock of what's en vogue on the celebrity front, we investigated which outdated celebrity fashion trends never made it past December 31, 2017, and found seven major trends that altogether vanished from celebrities' closets from then till now. Have you also noticed that items like bomber jackets and off-the-shoulder tops are nowhere to be found? Keep reading to see which pieces are out of sight, out of mind and which fresher styles have replaced them.

Left in 2017: Sock Boots (Image credit: Gotham/GC Images)

Swapped In: Square-Toe Boots (Image credit: BG021/Bauer-Griffin/GC Images)

Kendall Jenner wore a lot of ankle boots this year, but among her top styles on rotation, sleek square-toe boots were a clear favorite while the sock boots she wore all throughout 2017 were nowhere to be found.

Intentionally Blank More Hugs Square Toe Boots $229 SHOP NOW

Left in 2017: Bomber Jackets (Image credit: Raymond Hall/GC Images)

Swapped In: Windbreakers (Image credit: Gotham/GC Images)

Ashley Graham has long been our legging muse since we can always count on her to bring her athleisure A-game. This year, she swapped her bomber jackets for equally sporty but fresher-feeling windbreakers with her trusted leggings.

JoyLab Floral Chrysanthemum Print Raglan Softshell Jacket $37 SHOP NOW

Left in 2017: Cropped Denim Flares (Image credit: Raymond Hall/GC Images)

Swapped In: Baggy-Fit Jeans (Image credit: Pierre Suu/GC Images)

And now for our favorite topic: denim trends. Though cropped flares dominated in 2017, the style has completely vanished on both the celebrity and shopping fronts, overtaken by buzzy new loose-fit jeans.

Iro Ladyla Wide Leg Jeans $330 $231 SHOP NOW

Left in 2017: Baker-Boy Hats (Image credit: Raymond Hall/GC Images)

Swapped In: Bucket Hats (Image credit: Marc Piasecki/GC Images)

This was the year of the bucket hat, and no one made it look chicer than Kaia Gerber. The accessory-loving model showed us exactly how to infuse a bit of hypebae style into a sleeker wardrobe via the above outfit, leaving her baker-boy hats to gather dust in her closet.

Prada Triangle-Plaque Nylon Bucket Hat $310 SHOP NOW

Left in 2017: Crossbody Bags (Image credit: Ricky Vigil M/GC Images)

Swapped In: Shoulder Bags (Image credit: Backgrid)

Retro baguette bags came back into style in a major way, thanks to both By Far's new It bag (repped hard by Bella Hadid) and the resurgence of vintage styles from Fendi and Prada. The bag trend that was nowhere to be found this year? Crossbody styles.

By Far Rachel Croc-Effect Leather Shoulder Bag $365 SHOP NOW

Left in 2017: Platform Soles (Image credit: Ron Galella/WireImage)

Swapped In: Single-Sole Heels (Image credit: Gotham/GC Images)

Celebs like Priyanka Chopra who wear heels on repeat swapped their platform styles for sleeker single-sole pumps this year.

Malone Souliers by Roy Luwolt Maureen Mules $595 SHOP NOW

Left in 2017: Off-the-Shoulder Tops (Image credit: Roger/BACKGRID)

Swapped In: Bustier Tops (Image credit: Maciel/BACKGRID)

Earlier in the year, we shined a light on the bustier top trend, and it's clear that celebrities are opting for this style over more outdated off-the-shoulder going-out tops.

Brock Collection Tayten Floral-Print Silk-Jacquard Top $1190 SHOP NOW

Next: the worst bags for your back, from a chiropractor.
title: 7 Pieces Celebs Stopped Wearing Altogether in 2018

meta_data.description: See which outdated celebrity fashion trends never made it into 2018 from the year before and which new styles have replaced them.
